column4: hello, I am trying to use Ubuntu to connect to my home VPN. I have the pem file ip and password correctly set. I have tried creating a tap device by adding in a br0 device in /etc/network/interfaces restarted networking. I get connection timed out when i try to connect. I know the VPN is operational because I can connect on windows side.
what kind of vpn?
openvpn running on endian**
Do you get any errors on the server side or the client side?
its the client. i get 'connection to the server timed out' The server is functional because if i were to sign in now with M$ it would work properly
did you set the port correctly on the client?
yeah it is default 1194 but I set I manually configured it to 1194 in the connection manager
are you using network manager to set this up?
I set up the VPN connection with the connection manager yes
I was never able to get that working, I installed the openvpn client from apt and configured it that way.
Ok I will set that up and report back. Thanks for your assistance
just the 'openvpn' package?
yeah
I have /etc/openvpn/client.conf, and I start and stop it using "sudo service openvpn start client" and "sudo service openvpn stop"
thanks very useful information. I hate when things are easier to do in windows then in linux :(. this is so plug and play in windows.
yeah, I banged up against the network manager a few times... for wifi or just dhcp it's awesome... but... that seems to be about it's limit.
yeah this isn't the first time I have had issues with it before. I'll report back about how it goes.
no dice it says 'ok' but never connects :( I am going to try and do it through CLI. I changed 'dev tap' to 'dev br0' is this correct or should it be tap
tap
http://paste.lopsa.org/74
that's a slightly sanitized copy of my client.conf on my laptop
thank you I am going to try it again now.
Heyo greppy
